intro: Thesion micromerion, commonly known as the narrow-leaved thornapple, is a herbaceous plant native to arid and semi-arid regions of southern Africa. It features small, spiny leaves that are typically less than 1 inch in length, adapted to reduce water loss in its harsh environment. The plant produces clusters of small, yellowish-green flowers that bloom in late spring or early summer. Its fruit is a dry capsule containing several seeds, which are dispersed by wind. Thesion micromerion is often found in rocky soils and is relatively drought-tolerant, making it a resilient species in its native habitat.
